items.sentence: Some of the jokes that Tom told us weren't very funny.
I wish that Tom wouldn't sing so loudly late at night.
I can never keep up with what's going on in the world.
I think that Tom was the one who bought these flowers?
Would you happen to know where Tom bought those shoes?
I suspect that Tom will be able to do that eventually.
I suspect that Tom and Mary have both never done that.
I suspect that Tom and Mary don't know how to do that.
I suspect that Tom and Mary are the ones who did that.
My parents told me that we should respect the elderly.
I was scolded for not doing what I was supposed to do.
I'm sure that you know that I love biscuits and gravy.
I can't find a babysitter, so I can't go to the party.
Those changes took place over a relatively short time.
Tom opened the dishwasher and put in the dirty dishes.
Tom was the one who convinced Mary to quit doing that.
I've never seen anything like that happen around here.
Tom promised to keep what Mary told him under his hat.
Tom told Mary she'd just have to accept him as he was.
Tom was at a loss to explain where the money had gone.
What Tom was trying to tell Mary made no sense to her.
Tom is cool, calm, and collected, even under pressure.
Tom gets very animated when he's watching rugby on TV.
Tom hummed a tune to himself as he did the washing up.
Because he was sick, Tom wasn't able to take the test.
The witness identified the thief in the police lineup.
The treaty did not ban nuclear tests under the ground.
We don't know why there's more matter than antimatter.
Tom became paralyzed after falling off his skateboard.
Do you think that Tom will ever make money doing that?
Do you actually think that I'd do something like that?
I think that it's unlikely that Tom will ever do that.
Tom walked into the room, carrying two cups of coffee.
Tom was upset because Mary had forgotten his birthday.
Tom was forced to something that he didn't want to do.
There's a good chance Tom won't ask Mary to the dance.
That's not the main reason that Tom needed to do that.
Tom has gained weight since the last time you saw him.
Do both of these sentences really mean the same thing?
I received an email from Tom about thirty minutes ago.
Getting the right people to help us will be difficult.
I'm sure that Tom would love to go to Boston with you.
We have a lot of reasons why we don't want to do that.
There are more clouds today than there were yesterday.
The sunny side of the hill is full of deciduous trees.
My parents were the ones who taught me how to do that.
Nothing we asked Tom to do will be hard for him to do.
Is it true that Tom was able to swim across the river?
Tom told Mary that it was her turn to wash the dishes.
Some older kids beat me up on my way home from school.
